name: Lentil Curry Buns (Sambhar Buns)
description: Delicious savory and spicy lentil curry buns (sambhar buns) made with leftover lentil curry. So easy and great as a snack or with meals.Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups thick lentil curry ((sambhar) blended to puree)

recipeInstructions.text: Let the yeast sit in a quarter cup of warm water + 1 teaspoon sugar for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the yeast sit in a quarter cup of warm water + 1 teaspoon sugar for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the stand mixer bowl lightly. In the stand mixer bowl , add in the flours, salt and pepper and give it a quick mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the stand mixer bowl lightly. In the stand mixer bowl , add in the flours, salt and pepper and give it a quick mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the lentil curry(sambhar), cilantro leaves, oil and the yeast mixture and give them a quick mix with a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the lentil curry(sambhar), cilantro leaves, oil and the yeast mixture and give them a quick mix with a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead the dough for 2 minutes using the dough hook.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead the dough for 2 minutes using the dough hook.

recipeInstructions.text: Scrape sides and knead again for 2 minutes. If mixing by hand, keep kneading till a nice soft and not very sticky dough is formed. The sambhar will make the dough generally stickier than normal bread dough and will also give the baked bun a very soft and moist texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Scrape sides and knead again for 2 minutes. If mixing by hand, keep kneading till a nice soft and not very sticky dough is formed. The sambhar will make the dough generally stickier than normal bread dough and will also give the baked bun a very soft and moist texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead in batched of 2 minutes with intermittent scraping till a soft dough is formed.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead in batched of 2 minutes with intermittent scraping till a soft dough is formed.

recipeInstructions.text: Coat a bowl with oil and keep the dough in it , covered with a plastic wrap for rising.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat a bowl with oil and keep the dough in it , covered with a plastic wrap for rising.

recipeInstructions.text: Let it rise for an hour. Punch it down and make small balls.
recipeInstructions.name: Let it rise for an hour. Punch it down and make small balls.

recipeInstructions.text: Use the boule technique for a tighter crust and for the buns to rise more vertically ( pull dough gently using both hands in opp direction and tuck it in. Repeat 2-4 times to cover the circumference of the ball)
recipeInstructions.name: Use the boule technique for a tighter crust and for the buns to rise more vertically ( pull dough gently using both hands in opp direction and tuck it in. Repeat 2-4 times to cover the circumference of the ball)

recipeInstructions.text: Place buns an inch apart on a greased baking sheet. I got 8 big buns.
recipeInstructions.name: Place buns an inch apart on a greased baking sheet. I got 8 big buns.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush water on the buns and stick some flax seeds on them.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush water on the buns and stick some flax seeds on them.

recipeInstructions.text: Let rise covered by a towel for half an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Let rise covered by a towel for half an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 360 degrees F for 20 minutes. Times may very depending on the oven and amount and thickness of sambhar etc.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 360 degrees F for 20 minutes. Times may very depending on the oven and amount and thickness of sambhar etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool on wire rack for half an hour before munching on these savory buns with some garlicky olive oil or coconut chutney!. I also used them as burger buns with a veggie patty!
recipeInstructions.name: Cool on wire rack for half an hour before munching on these savory buns with some garlicky olive oil or coconut chutney!. I also used them as burger buns with a veggie patty!
